lines.gurmukhi: jYsy krpUr mY aufq ko suBwau qw qy Aaur bwsnw n qw kY AwgY ThwrveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Karapoor Mai Udat Ko Soubhaau Taa Tay , Aur Baasanaa N Taa Kai Aagai Tthahaaravaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the fragrance of camphor has the characteristic of spreading in the air, thus its smell cannot remain lodged in anything;

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn subws kY subwsnw bnwspqI qwhI qy sugMDqw skl sY smwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Soubaas Kai Soubaasanaa Banaasapatee , Taahee Tay Sougandhataa Sakal Sai Samaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: But vegetation around a Sandalwood tree become equally fragrant with the aroma released but it;

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jl imlq sRbMg sMg rMgu rwKY Agn jrwie sb rMgnu imtwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jal Milat Srabang Sang Rangu Raakhai , Agan Jaraai Sab Ranganu Mitaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As water acquires the same colour that is mixed in it, but fire destroys all the colours by burning them (into ashes);

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy riv sis isv skq suBwv giq sMjogI ibEgI diRstwqu kY idKwveI ]134]
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ravi Sasi Siv Sakat Soubhaav Gati , Sanjogee Biaogee Drisataatu Kai Dikhaavaee ?134?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the effect of Sun is undesirable (Tamoguni) while the moon has virtuous effect, similarly a Guru-conscious person behaves peacefully and virtuously while a self willed and apostate person caught in the evil effects of mammon is conspicuous. (134)
